RESPONSE TEXT: I don't know that this is the time...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Shaun: Doctor Holdren, it is time. Please.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Shaun: To that end, I am naming my father as my successor.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, boy.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Justin: You can't be serious!

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Shaun: May I say, Doctor Holdren, I'm quite impressed with the latest harvest from your division.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, thank you sir. Isaac and Dean did a great deal of work over the last few months. I'll let them know you're pleased with the result.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Allie: Doctor Ayo, did you still need modifications to the entryway for the SRB?

RESPONSE TEXT: Now's not really a good time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Great! I was hoping you'd say that.
RESPONSE TEXT: In any case, I imagine you'll want to continue looking around. Or, if you prefer, I'd be happy to answer any questions you might have.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You mentioned medical care. I might need that from time to time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You mentioned medical care. I might need that from time to time.
RESPONSE TEXT: In that case, you'll want to introduce yourself to Doctor Dean Volkert.
He's our top biologist, and also serves as the Institute's resident physician.
Doctor Volkert works in the infirmary. Just pay him a visit whenever you need to.
You won't find better medical care anywhere else in the Commonwealth, I'll promise you that.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm good for now, thanks.
RESPONSE TEXT: Take care, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Tell me more about those synth gorillas.
RESPONSE TEXT: On the whole, I'd say they were a success. Their behavior does generally match what our historical data says it should be.
Unfortunately, we had a few early setbacks. The creatures can become suddenly aggressive, and they're quite strong.
They destroyed two of their synth handlers, so now we keep them in an isolated habitat where they can be safely observed.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there anything I can do to help out?
RESPONSE TEXT: There might be. Tell you what. You get settled in, and check back with me later. I'll see what I can find.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there anything I can do to help out?
RESPONSE TEXT: I think Doctor Karlin was looking for help with one of his experiments. You should talk to him.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there anything I can do to help out?
RESPONSE TEXT: Not at the moment, but thanks for asking.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCMClaytonHoldren: Welcome! So good to have you here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Doctor Clayton Holdren, head of the BioScience division.
I can't wait for you to see the work we're doing. It's truly amazing.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I look forward to learning more about it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I look forward to learning more about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: In that case, let me give you a brief overview of what we do here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sure it's fascinating, but that's not why I'm here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course, I completely understand.
Before you go, at least let me give you a brief overview of what we do here. I promise I'll keep it short.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: As the name implies, the BioScience division specializes in fields of study such as botany, genetics and medicine.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Like what?
RESPONSE TEXT: I was just about to explain that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: As the name implies, the BioScience division specializes in fields of study such as botany, genetics and medicine.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: With hard work and ingenuity, any challenge can be overcome.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sure I've taken up enough of your time as it is, but I have to ask... have you decided whether you'll join us?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm not sure how well I'll fit in, but I'd like to give it a try.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm not sure how well I'll fit in, but I'd like to give it a try.
RESPONSE TEXT: Great! I was hoping you'd say that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: In any case, I imagine you'll want to continue looking around. Or, if you prefer, I'd be happy to answer any questions you might have.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I doubt it. I just don't think I'd fit in.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's a big decision, I know, but it's also a rare and important opportunity. No need to rush to judgement.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: In any case, I imagine you'll want to continue looking around. Or, if you prefer, I'd be happy to answer any questions you might have.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm an outsider. Would there even be a place for me here?
RESPONSE TEXT: Even if science isn't your passion, there are plenty of ways to contribute.
Our projects sometimes requires an agent who can work on the surface to observe and gather information.
From what I've heard, you're both fearless and resourceful. I think you'd be ideal for that kind of role.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: In any case, I imagine you'll want to continue looking around. Or, if you prefer, I'd be happy to answer any questions you might have.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: In that case, let me give you a brief overview of what we do here.
RESPONSE TEXT: As the name implies, the BioScience division specializes in fields of study such as botany, genetics and medicine.
Our most important directive is to ensure the health and well-being of everyone in the Institute.
To that end, we cultivate highly specialized breeds of flora for use in food and medicine.
We've even started to explore the idea of synthetic animal life.
You probably saw the gorillas... they're really just a pet project at this point, but the potential is exciting nonetheless.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Seems like there's nothing you guys can't do.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Seems like there's nothing you guys can't do.
RESPONSE TEXT: With hard work and ingenuity, any challenge can be overcome.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: I'm sure I've taken up enough of your time as it is, but I have to ask... have you decided whether you'll join us?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds like a waste of time to me. You should create something more useful.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's just my opinion, of course, but I don't believe that every discovery  needs to be useful.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, like a teacher with a student

RESPONSE TEXT: Sometimes, we innovate for no other reason than to learn what's possible.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: I'm sure I've taken up enough of your time as it is, but I have to ask... have you decided whether you'll join us?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Yeah, I can't imagine anything more exciting than fake gorillas.
RESPONSE TEXT: Speaking only for myself, I find them fascinating. Of course, I might be a little biased.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: I'm sure I've taken up enough of your time as it is, but I have to ask... have you decided whether you'll join us?
SCRIPT NOTES: A chuckle at the end of this line, the player just made a joke. Emphasis no "might". / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The gorillas are synths, too?
RESPONSE TEXT: They are indeed. Judging by your reaction, we've done a good job making them seem lifelike.
The initiative is still in its early stages, but the prospects are very exciting.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: I'm sure I've taken up enough of your time as it is, but I have to ask... have you decided whether you'll join us?

RESPONSE TEXT: It's alright, no hurry.
SCRIPT NOTES: Wondering why the player has stopped talking. Filling in dead air.

RESPONSE TEXT: Welcome! So good to have you here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: Doctor Clayton Holdren, head of the BioScience division.

RESPONSE TEXT: Good to see you again. Did you need something?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You mentioned medical care. I might need that from time to time.

RESPONSE TEXT: Something I can do for you?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You mentioned medical care. I might need that from time to time.

RESPONSE TEXT: Anything I can help you with?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You mentioned medical care. I might need that from time to time.

RESPONSE TEXT: I won't try to hide my disappointment about what happened at Warwick Homestead.
That Warwick situation was a real mess. You're not exactly off to a great start here.
I hope you've learned something from what happened at Warwick. That was a costly mistake.
Humanity's future is taking root right here.
It's great to have you here.
Doctor Karlin's doing some amazing things with our genetically-engineered crops.
The latest synth generation is just amazing. Those guys in robotics are working miracles.
Don't forget to speak to Doctor Karlin about that errand.
Doctor Karlin needs your help with something. You should speak to him.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What kind of work will we be doing, exactly?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, normally the Directorate reviews and approves research tracks for the various divisions. Today, however, we're here for a different reason.
DIALOGUE AFTER: JustinAyo: Right now we're all here because it's time to decide to finally stand up for ourselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: AlanaSecord: It's the only way of looking at it, Allie. You know that as well as the rest of us.
RESPONSE TEXT: To bring you up to speed: Obviously there are groups in the Commonwealth that stand in opposition to the Institute's goals.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: With the reactor now online, we have the ability to not only expand synth production, but to project power to a much greater degree.
SCRIPT NOTES: changing the subject, trying to calm tense situation

DIALOGUE BEFORE: ClaytonHoldren: To bring you up to speed: Obviously there are groups in the Commonwealth that stand in opposition to the Institute's goals.
RESPONSE TEXT: With the reactor now online, we have the ability to not only expand synth production, but to project power to a much greater degree.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sure the reactor will improve everyone's life. It's a great accomplishment.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sure the reactor will improve everyone's life. It's a great accomplishment.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, but it's not just that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: The Directorate has... agreed that steps must be taken to ensure our safety in the long run...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So you're saying we can now wage war on the Commonwealth.
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't think anyone really intended that as a course of action.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: The Directorate has... agreed that steps must be taken to ensure our safety in the long run...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We'll be much better able to defend ourselves. It's a good position.
RESPONSE TEXT: True, but I don't think we should stop there.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: The Directorate has... agreed that steps must be taken to ensure our safety in the long run...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Where are you going with this? What's the Institute's goal?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well...
DIALOGUE AFTER: ClaytonHoldren: The Directorate has... agreed that steps must be taken to ensure our safety in the long run...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Yes, but it's not just that.
RESPONSE TEXT: The Directorate has... agreed that steps must be taken to ensure our safety in the long run...
DIALOGUE AFTER: EvanWatson: Let's just spit it out, shall we? The Directorate has decided that the Brotherhood of Steel need to be eliminated.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I think the last thing the Institute needs now is to make things worse. We should be trying to avoid conflict, not starting it.
RESPONSE TEXT: I would love to see that big airship fly off over the horizon, but it's not going to happen.
The conflict is already upon us; unless we end it now it's only going to get worse.
DIALOGUE AFTER: AllieFilmore: We really don't have a choice. If we're to emerge from this the victors, we need to move quickly.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: Have you had time to examine my latest reports on batch two-seven-four?
RESPONSE TEXT: Not yet. I've been reviewing Father's plans to expand our operations at Warwick.
He's eager to get that going, so I've had to put everything else to one side.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: I wonder how the Warwick family is doing. Young Wally must be close to ten years old by now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: It's remarkable that any child can survive for so long up there.
RESPONSE TEXT: I... try not to think too much about it. We have more than enough to occupy ourselves here.
Those people are the last remnants of a dying past. It's best not to dwell on the subject.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: They're still people, and they're suffering. We can at least admit that it's regrettable.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: After all, how can we hope to redefine mankind if we can't even hold on to our own humanity?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, that's a question best left to our colleagues in the Robotics division.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Yes, well... I suppose you're right.

RESPONSE TEXT: Did you add those new strains of triacanthos we discovered to the database?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Yes, Doctor Holdren, it's taken care of.
SCRIPT NOTES: A scientist at work. TRI-uh-CAN-thos where "TRI" is like tricycle and THOS is like floss.

RESPONSE TEXT: Isaac, have you had a chance to run the alkalinity test on last week's soil sample from Warwick?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Yes, Doctor Holdren, it's taken care of.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: Yes, Doctor Holdren, it's taken care of.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good man, good man.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: The compliment is quite unnecessary, Doctor Holdren.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: Yes, Doctor Holdren, it's taken care of.

To test this theory, I'll need a tissue sample from a particularly strong Super Mutant.
I expect I'll eventually need several such samples, but let's just start with one.

This feels like the dawn of a new era.

RESPONSE TEXT: I have every confidence you'll make a fine director.
I couldn't be more pleased with Father's choice for a new director. Congratulations.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: InstituteScientist: Doctor Holdren, I was told you were looking for me.

DIALOGUE AFTER: InstituteScientist: Unfortunately there's been too much harmful exposure for it to be useful. From preliminary testing it appears the water radiation was lethal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: InstituteScientist: Unfortunately there's been too much harmful exposure for it to be useful. From preliminary testing it appears the water radiation was lethal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: InstituteScientist: Doctor, I was thinking, if our modified subject deteriorated so quickly then how can anything else possibly survive up there?
RESPONSE TEXT: Frankly, they don't. The surface is still too dangerous for life to truly thrive. That's why what we do here is so important.
Thanks for running those seeds up to Warwick Homestead.
Our synth at Warwick sent his first report. Thanks for taking care of that.
